newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: New Zealand shares end strong before CPI.
newsitem.headline: New Zealand shares end strong before CPI.

text.p: * Shares inch higher on second day of high turnover
* Low CPI, fall in rates could provide fresh impetus
The top-40 index is testing key chart points close to its life high of 2,444.80, set in February 1994.
"There's a lot of people selling into this strength, thinking that maybe it won't carry through that level, but it may well get through it yet, we don't know," said Richard Burton at Cavill White.

With the Reserve Bank forecasting quarterly underlying inflation of 0.5 percent for an annual 2.3 percent, brokers said a lower number could push interest rates lower and give equities a fresh shot in the arm. Burton said the other key factor would be the direction of the U.S. market.
Among the leaders, all the Fletcher Challenge stocks were strong on good volume and Carter Holt Harvey made up ground from Wednesday, adding four to $3.33.
"Pulp and paper sectors around the world have been looking much better in recent weeks. That continued in Fletcher Paper," Davenport said.
Elsewhere brewer DB firmed two to $0.99 on volume of 3.76 million shares and Tourism Holdings jumped 13 to $2.65.
